item.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H3500)
Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

summary.text: Requires: (1) the Clerk of the House of Representatives to post on the public Internet site of his Office a record, organized by Member name, of the recorded votes of each Member taken in the House and any cost estimate of the Congressional Budget Office (CBO) related to the vote; and (2) each Member who maintains an official public Internet site using amounts from the Members' Representation Allowance to provide an electronic link to such Member's individual recorded vote information.

bill.title: Directing the Clerk to post on the public Internet site of the Office of the Clerk a record, organized by Member name, of recorded votes taken in the House, and directing each Member who maintains an official public Internet site to provide an electronic link to such record.

item.title: Directing the Clerk to post on the public Internet site of the Office of the Clerk a record, organized by Member name, of recorded votes taken in the House, and directing each Member who maintains an official public Internet site to provide an electronic link to such record.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
